newsitem.title: USA: Kansas feedlot cattle market at standstill - USDA.
newsitem.headline: Kansas feedlot cattle market at standstill - USDA.

text.p: DODGE CITY, July 15 (Reuder) - Trade was quiet, with no sales slaughter steers or heifers confirmed, USDA said.

Inquiry was good and demand light. Sales confirmed for the week to date on 15,000 cattle, mostly previously contracted or formulated cattle. Asking prices $64.00-$66.00 per cwt, mostly $64.00-$65.00, bids $62.00. Last sales at $62.00 Friday.
Sales FOB feedlot net weights after 4 percent shrink.
Confirmed - none Last week - 3,500 Last year - none
Wk to date - 15,000 Last week - 59,500 Last year - 7,200
